intro: Mercurialis tomentosa var. bichei, commonly known as the woolly mercury. It is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia, characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, which give it a soft, fuzzy appearance. The species is part of the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
